abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Essential Public Health
            Functions and Programs Project for Argentina were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: financing public health functions
            instead of vertical programs (HIV/AIDS, immunization, etc.)
            allows for the improvement of the delivery of vertical
            programs while strengthening health systems overall. In
            federal settings where provinces have a large degree of
            autonomy, the signing of 5-year umbrella agreements between
            federal and state levels outlining each party's
            responsibilities protects against political risk. The
            inclusion of an emergency contingency component in
            investment operations is an effective approach to address
            emergencies. Realistic risk assessment regarding
            implementation capacity will ensure the needed support is
            built into project design. Project evaluation methodologies
            need to be defined during preparation to ensure the needed
            information is available. The Governance and Accountability
            Action Plan (GAAP) provides a common fiduciary tool to
            address overall systemic accountability issues. Its joint
            design with the Government will increase ownership and
            effectiveness. In addition, agreed supervision plan and
            regular close supervision by the Bank's fiduciary team
            has substantially reduced implementation risk since its introduction.
